revised_title: Long-term Variations in Cosmic-Ray Flux: A Discussion on the Origin of Cosmic Radiation
tldr: This article discusses the long-term variations in cosmic-ray flux and the origin of cosmic radiation. The authors analyze isotopic changes and alterations in meteoritic and lunar materials to deduce information on the history of cosmic-ray protons during the Solar System's formation. They also explore the implications of the absence of significant time variations in the flux and energy spectra of protons and heavy nuclei, relating to cosmic-ray sources and propagation.
